page.title: 01SW BASINGSTOKE: GENERAL NOTE
page.content: The South_Western area of Basingstoke is most notable for the sharp contrast between the traditional rural village environment and intensive modern housing development. The area known as{Brighton Hill}is entirely a product of the 1970's and early 1980's. It was brought about by the assisted migration of industry from London to the cheaper area of Basingstoke. Brighton Hill was therefore one Basingstoke's many satellite housing estates constructed to accommodate the accompanying workforces. The M3 motorway forms the southern boundary of the estate _ beyond it lies open, unspoilt farmland in the midst of which lies the village of { {Cliddesden. }
